1.subquestion: How many friends remain as pen pals with Mike now?

subanswer.text: Initially, Mike had five pen pals; however, he dropped one from those contacts. Hence, Mike retains 5 - 1 = 4 pen pals now. The answer is 4.

0.user_question: Mike was a pen pal with 5 people.  He stopped being penpals with 7020326 of them.  They each send 7020326 letters a week that are 5 pages long.  He responds in kind.  He can write a page every 6 minutes.  How many hours does he spend writing a week?

direct_answer.text: Firstly let us calculate the amount of responses Mike needs to prepare per person which equals (7020326*5) / 6= |response time|/people; this comes out as around 585054 messages since we only need whole numbers when dealing with counting items such as mail or packages. As all these friends sent one letter to him within a certain period it means if you add up everyone’s message volume together ,it becomes about  2910270 messages(messages exchanged).Now assume that reply takes same length i.e., 5 sheets per friend .So here again considering full mails no half bills etc therefore assuming rounding off upto nearest integer values.(i.e adding both sides),we get approx..((2910270+585054)*5)/6 =~~ 2587627pages thus coming down roughly near ~2^22 bits.This quantity requires nearly equal bit space comparative to processing speed offered through GPU but not CPU so hence our solution involves using Nvidia GeForce GTX TITAN Black card having core architecture clock frequency set @approx .....around 1G

direct_answer.text: Firstly let us calculate the amount of responses Mike needs to prepare per person which equals (7020326*5) / 6= |response time|/people; this comes out as around 585054 messages since we only need whole numbers when dealing with counting items such as mail or packages. As all these friends sent one letter to him within a certain period it means if you add up everyone’s message volume together ,it becomes about  2910270 messages(messages exchanged).Now assume that reply takes same length i.e., 5 sheets per friend .So here again considering full mails no half bills etc therefore assuming rounding off upto nearest integer values.(i.e adding both sides),we get approx..((2910270+585054)*5)/6 =~~ 2587627pages thus coming down roughly near ~2^22 bits.This quantity requires nearly equal bit space comparative to processing speed offered through GPU but not CPU so hence our solution involves using Nvidia GeForce GTX TITAN Black card having core architecture clock frequency set @approx .....around 1G
